xqdoc:description.p: This library module provides token-based string similarity functions that view strings as sets or multi-sets of tokens and use set-related properties to compute similarity scores.
The tokens correspond to groups of characters extracted from the strings being compared, such as individual words or character n-grams.
These functions are particularly useful for matching near duplicate strings in cases where typographical conventions often lead to rearrangement of words (e.g., "John Smith" versus "Smith, John").

The logic contained in this module is not specific to any particular XQuery implementation, although the module requires the trigonometic functions of XQuery 3.0 or a math extension function such as sqrt($x as numeric) for computing the square root.
Returns the individual character n-grams forming a string.
Example usage : ngrams("FLWOR", 2 )
The function invocation in the example above returns : ("_F" , "FL" , "LW" , "WO" , "LW" , "WO" , "OR" , "R_")

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $n The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The sequence of strings with the extracted n-grams.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:ngrams
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:ngrams($s as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:string*

xqdoc:description.p: Auxiliary function for computing the cosine similarity coefficient between strings, using stringdescriptors based on sets of character n-grams or sets of tokens extracted from two strings.
Example usage : cosine( ("aa","bb") , ("bb","aa"))
The function invocation in the example above returns : 1.0

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $desc1 The descriptor for the first string.
$desc2 The descriptor for the second string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The cosine similarity coefficient between the descriptors for the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:cosine
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:cosine($desc1 as xs:string*, $desc2 as xs:string*) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the Dice similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.
Example usage : dice-ngrams("DWAYNE", "DUANE", 2 )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.4615384615384616

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $n The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The Dice similarity coefficient between the sets of character n-grams extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:dice-ngrams
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:dice-ngrams($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the overlap similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.
Example usage : overlap-ngrams("DWAYNE", "DUANE", 2 )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.5

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $n The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The overlap similarity coefficient between the sets of character n-grams extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:overlap-ngrams
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:overlap-ngrams($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the Jaccard similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.
Example usage : jaccard-ngrams("DWAYNE", "DUANE", 2 )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.3

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $n The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The Jaccard similarity coefficient between the sets of character n-grams extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:jaccard-ngrams
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:jaccard-ngrams($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the cosine similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.
The n-grams from each string are weighted according to their occurence frequency (i.e., weighted according to the term-frequency heuristic from Information Retrieval).
Example usage : cosine-ngrams("DWAYNE", "DUANE", 2 )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.2401922307076307

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $n The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The cosine similarity coefficient between the sets n-grams extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:cosine-ngrams
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:cosine-ngrams($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the Dice similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.
Example usage : dice-tokens("The FLWOR Foundation", "FLWOR Found.", " +" )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.4

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $r A regular expression forming the delimiter character(s) which mark the boundaries between adjacent tokens.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The Dice similarity coefficient between the sets tokens extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:dice-tokens
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:dice-tokens($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $r as xs:string) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the overlap similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.
Example usage : overlap-tokens("The FLWOR Foundation", "FLWOR Found.", " +" )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.5

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $r A regular expression forming the delimiter character(s) which mark the boundaries between adjacent tokens.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The overlap similarity coefficient between the sets tokens extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:overlap-tokens
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:overlap-tokens($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $r as xs:string) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the Jaccard similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.
Example usage : jaccard-tokens("The FLWOR Foundation", "FLWOR Found.", " +" )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.25

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $r A regular expression forming the delimiter character(s) which mark the boundaries between adjacent tokens.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The Jaccard similarity coefficient between the sets tokens extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:jaccard-tokens
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:jaccard-tokens($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $r as xs:string) as xs:double

xqdoc:description.p: Returns the cosine similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings. The tokens from each string are weighted according to their occurence frequency (i.e., weighted according to the term-frequency heuristic from Information Retrieval).
Example usage : cosine-tokens("The FLWOR Foundation", "FLWOR Found.", " +" )
The function invocation in the example above returns : 0.408248290463863

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $r A regular expression forming the delimiter character(s) which mark the boundaries between adjacent tokens.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The cosine similarity coefficient between the sets tokens extracted from the two strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: simt:cosine-tokens
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function simt:cosine-tokens($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $r as xs:string) as xs:double
